text.value: A hash function is "any function that can be used to map data of arbitrary size to data of a fixed size." Common hash functions are SHA-1 and SHA-256. We can emulate a hash function by using square root (to 5 signigicant figures). Let's imagine we have a file which holds the numeric value of 22500. What is its hash value (Remember Significant Figures means there has to be that many digits including the first non-zero digit, e.g. 1.0000)?
If this was 1900 you would still have to get out your slide rule. Luckily we have smartphones. Just remember the zeroes.
